1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to shriek; (by implication) to proclaim (an assembly)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before

2.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)

4.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

5.brief: to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to cut down or off; (figuratively) to destroy, divide, exclude, or decide

6.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)
lowermost; as noun (feminine plural) the depths (figuratively, a pit, the womb)
a deep place (of water or mud)

7.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)

8.brief: to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to place (in a very wide application)
properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
to restrict, by act (hold back or in) or word (prohibit)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

9.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
near, with or among; often in general, to
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power

10.brief: to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, lax, i.e. (figuratively) a ghost (as dead; in plural only)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)

11.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity

12.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

13.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)

14.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

15.brief: to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)

16.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

17.brief: to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to strike with more or less violence (beat, fell, corrode); by implication (of attack) to knock together, i.e. surround or circulate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

18.brief: to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
